description: An ancient Roman town of Campania destroyed by the eruption of Mt. Vesuvius in A.D. 79. Named as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1997.

history.comment: created darmc citation to preserve project linkage after DARMC location was withdrawn
Wallace-Hadrill 2011; added contributor jfu since contributor attempted to add reference to an unlocated place
changed type for wikidata to related
add ToposText reference provided by bkiesling
Location updates and tags from Johan Ahlfeldt's (jahlfeldt) Digital Atlas of the Roman Empire in October 2012
Global migration and reindexing of citations and provenance, February 2012
New locations, coordinates, and metadata from Harvard's DARMC project. See http://atlantides.org/trac/pleiades/wiki/PlaceUpgradesAndMigrations
Detail text updated from former modernLocation. See http://atlantides.org/trac/pleiades/wiki/PlaceDetailsUpgrade
Global migration and reindexing of citations and provenance, February 2012

names.description: The modern Italian name of the ancient Campanian site of Herculaneum
